Trade/Device Name(s): BD Phoenix Automated Microbiology System Vancomycin (0.0625-32 μg/mL) - Streptococcus ID/AST or AST
BD PhoenixM Automated Microbiology System for use with the antimicrobial agent vancomycin (0.0625-32 μg/mL) - Streptococcus ID/AST or AST only Phoenix Panels
Regulation Name(s): Fully Automated Short-Term Incubation Cycle Antimicrobial Susceptibility Devices
Specimen Type(s): Pure culture isolates (Gram-negative aerobic and facultative anaerobic bacteria; Gram-positive bacteria: Staphylococcus, Enterococcus, Streptococcus)
Document Summary: FDA 510(k) summary for BD Phoenix Automated Microbiology System Streptococcus ID/AST panels for vancomycin antimicrobial susceptibility testing
Indications for Use Summary: Intended for in vitro quantitative determination of antimicrobial susceptibility by minimal inhibitory concentration (MIC) of most Gram-negative aerobic and facultative anaerobic bacteria isolates from pure culture and most Gram-positive bacteria isolates from Staphylococcus, Enterococcus, and Streptococcus, with vancomycin added to Streptococcus ID/AST panels at concentrations of 0.0625-32 μg/mL.
